revision.comment: /* Company owner */fix duplicate dead link tags using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
{{For|Rodriguez's son, the professional skateboarder|Paul Rodriguez (skateboarder)}} {{BLP sources|date= March 2013}} {{Infobox comedian | name = Paul Rodriguez | image = Paul Rodriguez USO.jpg | imagesize = 180px | caption = Rodriguez at a [[United Service Organizations|USO]] show aboard the [[USS Nimitz (CVN-68)|USS Nimitz]] on June 19, 2003 | birth_name = Paul Rodriguez | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1955|01|19}} | birth_place = [[Culiacan]], [[Sinaloa]], [[Mexico]] | medium = [[Stand-up comedy]], [[film]], [[television]] | nationality = [[Mexico|Mexican]] | genre = Observational | subject = | influences = | active = 1983–present | children = [[Paul Rodriguez (skateboarder)|Paul Rodriguez, Jr.]] | spouse = }} '''Paul Rodriguez, Sr.''' (born January 19, 1955) is a [[Mexican-American]] [[stand-up comedian]] and [[actor]]. ==Early life== Paul Rodriguez was born in [[Culiacan]], [[Sinaloa]], to Mexican agriculture ranchers.{{cite web|title=Paul Rodriguez Biography (1955-)|url=http://www.filmreference.com/film/87/Paul-Rodriguez.html|work=Film Reference|publisher=Advameg, Inc|accessdate=13 April 2013|year=2013}} His family later migrated to [[Compton, California|Compton]], [[California]], where Rodriguez enlisted in the [[United States Air Force]] and was subsequently stationed in [[Uruguay]] and [[Duluth, Minnesota]]. ==Career== ===Television=== He first appeared in ''[[a.k.a. Pablo]]'', a [[sitcom]] produced by [[Embassy Television]] for [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]], but the show was canceled after six episodes. In 1988 Rodriguez replaced [[Bob Eubanks]] as host of ''[[The Newlywed Game]]'' and lasted one season before cancellation. During his tenure as host, the show began using the 1958 song "[[The Book of Love (song)|The Book of Love]]", by [[The Monotones]], as a theme song.{{citation needed|date=September 2016}} He later hosted a Friday nighttime television show called ''El Show de Paul Rodriguez'' that was broadcast on [[Univision]] from March 2, 1990 to January 1, 1993.{{Citation needed|date=April 2013}} From 2010 to 2011, Rodriguez hosted two seasons of the [[Tr3s|MTV Tr3́s]] comedy home video series ''Mis Videos Locos''. The reality show features video footage of Latino people from various countries who are filmed by devices such as surveillance cameras and mobile phones.{{cite web|title=Comedian Paul Rodriguez Returns to Tr3s: MTV, Musica y Mas With Second Season of 'Mis Videos Locos'|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases-test/comedian-paul-rodriguez-returns-to-tr3s-mtv-musica-y-mas-with-second-season-of-mis-videos-locos-117590238.html|work=PR Newswire|publisher=PR Newswire Association LLC|accessdate=13 April 2013|date=8 March 2011}} ===Film=== Rodriguez has appeared in several feature films, such as ''[[Blood Work (film)|Blood Work]]'' with [[Clint Eastwood]], ''[[D.C. Cab]]'', ''[[Born in East L.A. (film)|Born in East L.A.]]'', ''[[Tortilla Soup]]'', ''[[Rat Race (2001 film)|Rat Race]]'', and ''[[Ali (film)|Ali]]'', and has also performed voiceover roles for ''[[King of the Hill]]'', ''[[Dora the Explorer]]'', and ''[[Beverly Hills Chihuahua]]''. Rodriguez has also undertaken other roles in the film industry: He directed and starred in the film ''[[A Million to Juan]]'', and he produced and appeared in the 2002 comedy film ''[[The Original Latin Kings of Comedy]]''.{{Citation needed|date=April 2013}} In 2009 the ''Paul Rodriguez: Comedy Rehab'' movie featured a night of Latino comedy that is hosted by Rodriguez{{cite web|title=Paul Rodriguez: Comedy Rehab: Overview|url=http://movies.msn.com/movies/movie/paul-rodriguez-comedy-rehab/|work=msn Entertainment|publisher=Microsoft|accessdate=13 April 2013|author=Perry Seibert|year=2013}} and ''Paul Rodriguez: Just for the Record'', which documents a live performance by the comedian, was released in 2011.{{cite web|title=Paul Rodriguez: Just for the Record: Overview|url=http://movies.msn.com/movies/movie/paul-rodriguez-just-for-the-record/|work=msn Entertainment|publisher=Microsoft|accessdate=13 April 2013|author=Cammila Collar|year=2013}} ==Awards== In 2004 [[Comedy Central]] ranked him at #74 on its list of the "100 Greatest [[Stand-up comedy|Standups]] of all Time."{{IMDb title|429332|Comedy Central Presents: 100 Greatest Stand-Ups of All Time}} Rodriguez was acknowledged with the "Humanitarian of the Year Award" by the City of Fresno for his work in the area of water conservation.{{cite news|title=Paul Rodriguez - The original Latin King of Comedy at Tommy T's this weekend!|url=http://www.sacramentopress.com/headline/36067/Paul_Rodriguez_The_original_Latin_King_of_Comedy_at_Tommy_Ts_this_weekend|accessdate=13 April 2013|newspaper=Sacramento Press|date=2 September 2010|author=Steven Bloom|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101206063409/http://www.sacramentopress.com/headline/36067/Paul_Rodriguez_The_original_Latin_King_of_Comedy_at_Tommy_Ts_this_weekend|archivedate=6 December 2010|df=}} ==Company owner== Rodriguez is a part-owner of the [[Laugh Factory]] comedy venue in [[Hollywood, Los Angeles, California]], U.S., where comedian/actor [[Michael Richards]] was filmed as he engaged in a highly publicized on-stage rant against two black male hecklers.{{cite news|title=Michael Richards, aka Kramer, spews racial slurs during stand-up|url=http://www.signonsandiego.com/news/state/20061120-1649-ca-people-michaelrichards.html|accessdate=13 April 2013|newspaper=The San Diego Union-Tribune|date=20 November 2006|author=Lynn Elber}} Of Richards' repeated use of the word "[[nigger]]", Rodriguez said, "Once the word comes out of your mouth and you don't happen to be African American, then you have a whole lot of explaining to do."[http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/n/a/2006/11/20/entertainment/e142041S77.DTL&feed=rss.news "Richards Racial Tirade Draws Castigation"] SFgate.com news as retrieved 18 December 2006{{Dead link|date=April 2013}} Rodriguez also has an interest in farming and owns operations in California's [[Central Valley (California)|Central Valley]]. ==Charity work== Rodriguez is known for his charity work and many of Rodriguez's comedy specials cover serious issues that are of concern to the Latino community. He has performed for several [[Comic Relief]] charity specials and, in 1995, he performed a comedy television special that was broadcast live from [[San Quentin State Prison]]. He is the chairman of the California Latino Water Coalition, a group that campaigns to draw attention to California's dire water situation, and was influential in the enactment of the California Water Bond Measure.{{cite web|title=About|url=http://www.paulrodriguez.com/about.htm|work=Paul Rodriguez|publisher=Paul Rodriguez|accessdate=13 April 2013|year=2013}} ==Politics== Rodriguez has been a vocal and active supporter of the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican Party]]. In 2010 Rodriguez endorsed Republican Meg Whitman during her campaign against Jerry Brown to become governor of California.{{cite news|title=Paul Rodriguez endorses Meg For all these reasons Rodriguez is widely considered a sellout in the Latino community. Whitman|url=http://blogs.sacbee.com/capitolalertlatest/2010/09/paul-rodriguez-endorses-meg-wh.html|accessdate=13 April 2013|newspaper=The Sacramento Bee|date=27 September 2010|author=Torey Van Oot}} Rodriguez then endorsed Republican Candidate [[Mitt Romney]] during the [[United States presidential election, 2012|2012 presidential election]] and recorded a radio promotion in Spanish for Romney's campaign.{{cite web|title=Comedian Paul Rodriguez Cuts An Ad For Romney|url=http://politic365.com/2012/10/19/comedian-paul-rodriguez-cuts-an-ad-for-romney/|work=Politic365|publisher=Politic365|accessdate=13 April 2013|author=Adriana Maestas|date=19 October 2012}} Rodriguez also collaborated with former governor of California [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]] as part of his work with the California Latino Water Coalition. ==Personal life== Rodriguez's son [[Paul Rodriguez (skateboarder)|Paul Rodriguez Jr.]] is a professional [[skateboarder]] (also known as "P-Rod").{{cite web|title=Paul Rodriguez Interrogated|url=http://theberrics.com/interrogation/paul-rodriguez.html|work=The Berrics|publisher=The Berrics|accessdate=13 April 2013|author=Stephen Cox|date=11 April 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130413072308/http://theberrics.com/interrogation/paul-rodriguez.html|archivedate=13 April 2013|df=}}{{cite web|title=WEDNESDAYS WITH REDA Day With P-Rod Part 2|url=http://theberrics.com/wednesdays-with-reda/day-with-p-rod-part-2.html|work=The Berrics|publisher=The Berrics|accessdate=31 December 2012|author=Giovanni Reda|format=Video upload|date=11 April 2012}} ==Discography== *1986: ''You're in America now, speak Spanish'' *1997: ''Cheese 'n' macaroni'' ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable" |+ Film |- ! Pablo]]'' | Paul Rivera | 6 episodes |- | rowspan="3"|1986 | ''Hardesty House'' | | |- | ''[[Tall Tales & Legends]]'' | Julio | '''Episode''': Ponce de Leon |- | ''[[The Golden Girls]]'' | Ramone | [[List of The Golden Girls episodes#Season Two|Episode: Vacation]] |- | 1988–1989 | ''[[Trial and Error (TV series)|Trial and Error]]'' | Tony Rivera | 8 episodes |- | 1988–1989 | ''[[The Newlywed Game]]'' | Himself |- | 1990 | ''Grand Slam'' | Pedro Gomez | 8 episodes |- | rowspan="2"|1991 | ''[[Hi Honey - I'm Dead]]'' | Ralph (The Angel) | TV-Movie |- | ''[[Great Performances]]'' | Satanas | '''Episode''': La Pastorela |- | rowspan="3"|1995 | ''Live in San Quentin, Paul Rodriguez'' | Himself | Live TV-Special |- | ''The Eddie Files'' | Construction Worker | '''Episode''': Geometry - Invasion of the Polygons |- | ''[[Touched by an Angel]]'' | Ben Rivera | [[List of Touched by an Angel episodes#Season 2|Episode: Trust]] |- |1995-1997 |''[[Happily Ever After: Fairy Tales for Every Child]]'' |Jesse the jester/Gilbert/Tizoc |Episode: Sleeping Beauty/The Fisherman and his Wife/The Shoemaker and the Elves |- | 1996 | ''Latino Laugh Festival'' | Himself | Live TV-Special |- | 1998 | ''[[King of the Hill]]'' | Jacinto | [[Three Days of the Kahndo|Episode: Three Days of the Kahndo]] |- | 2000 | ''[[Ready to Run (film)|Ready to Run]]'' | T.J. | Voice Role

[[List of The Proud Family episodes#Season 2: 2002–2003|Episode: Adventures in BeBe-Sitting]] |- | ''[[Dora the Explorer]]'' | Leon, the Circus Lion | Voice Role
[[List of Dora the Explorer episodes#Season 2|Episode: Leon, the Circus Lion]] |- | 2005 | ''[[The Buzz on Maggie]]'' | Julio's Father | Voice Role
[[List of The Buzz on Maggie episodes#Episodes|Episode: Lunchlady]] |- | 2005 | ''[[Zatch Bell]]'' | Teenager, Various Voices | 1 episode |- | 2010–2012 | ''[[Mis Videos Locos]]'' | Himself | 40 episodes for MTV Tr3s |} ==Awards and nominations== '''[[ALMA Award]]''' *1999: Nominated, "Outstanding Performance by an Individual or Act in a Variety or Comedy Special" - ''Comic Relief VIII'' *2002: Nominated, "Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture" - ''Tortilla Soup'' '''[[Imagen Awards]]''' *2009: Nominated, "Best Supporting Actor/Feature Film" - ''Beverly Hills Chihuahua'' '''NCLR Bravo Awards''' *1996: '''Won''', "Outstanding Performance by a Male in a Variety or Music Series/Special" - ''Latino Laugh Festival'' ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{commons|Paul Rodriguez}} *{{Official website|http://www.paulrodriguez.com}} *{{IMDb name|0735467}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Rodriguez, Paul}} [[Category:1955 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American male comedians]] [[Category:American male film actors]] [[Category:American male television actors]] [[Category:American male voice actors]] [[Category:American game show hosts]] [[Category:California Republicans]] [[Category:Hispanic and Latino American male actors]] [[Category:Male actors from Sinaloa]] [[Category:United States Air Force airmen]] [[Category:People from Culiacán]] [[Category:Virgin Records artists]] [[Category:Male actors from Los Angeles]] [[Category:Mexican emigrants to the United States]] [[Category:Comedians from California]] [[Category:20th-century American comedians]] [[Category:21st-century American comedians]] [[Category:People with acquired American citizenship]]
